intro: Coutarea hexandra var. typica, commonly known as the Amazonian arrow poison plant, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its toxic alkaloids, which have been traditionally used by indigenous peoples for hunting purposes. Its bark and roots contain a variety of bioactive compounds, making it a subject of interest in pharmacological research. Despite its medicinal potential, it is highly poisonous and requires careful handling.
